Nose Bleed
Bleeding from the nose is quite common in children or even in adults during 
summer.  There are two important things to do when this happens.
✱  A cloth wrapped in 1-2 ice cubes should be applied on the nose for some time. 
✱  A piece of cotton can be placed gently inside the nostril after smearing a little Vaseline around and just inside the nostrils.
✱  Another method is to avoid bending forward or down. Instead the head and neck should be tipped back and rested on a pillow or the back of a chair for 
10-15 minutes.
✱  The nose can be pinched between the thumb and forefinger for about 7-10 
minutes, while the person breathes through the mouth. This may be helpful 
to control and stop the blood flow as it will put pressure on the bleeding 
portion.
